EarningsNestle announces plans to slash 16,000 jobs, stock jumps 9%
Published Thu, Oct 16 20252:56 AM EDTUpdated Thu, Oct 16 202512:25 PM EDT
Carolin Roth@CarolinCNBC
ShareShare Article via FacebookShare Article via TwitterShare Article via LinkedInShare Article via Email
Key Points
  • Shares of Nestle surged 9.3% as the firmâ€™s new CEO Philipp Navratil looks to accelerate a turnaround.
  • The stock price jump boosted Europeâ€™s food and beverage sector, with the sector closing 4.2% on Thursday.
  • In a bid to improve operational efficiency, Nestle said it will cut 12,000 white-collar jobs and a further 4,000 roles will be reduced over the next two years.
